intro: Amorphophallus bolikhamxayensis, commonly known as the Bolikhamxay arrowhead, is a rare member of the Araceae family native to Laos. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and a solitary, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant produces a large, fleshy tuber that serves as its primary storage organ. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
